dt: {bc}a person qualified to vote in an election
{bc}a person appointed by a state in the U.S. to vote for president and vice president in the {d_link|electoral college|electoral college}

dt.t: When Americans cast their ballots, they are actually voting for a slate of {wi}electors{/wi} appointed by their state's political parties who are pledged to support that party's candidate.

dt: {bc}any of the German princes entitled to take part in choosing the Holy Roman Emperor

shortdef: a person qualified to vote in an election
a person appointed by a state in the U.S. to vote for president and vice president in the electoral college
any of the German princes entitled to take part in choosing the Holy Roman Emperor

dt: {bc}an elector who votes in the electoral college for a candidate other than the one who won the popular vote in the elector's state

dt.t: The U.S. Supreme Court has unanimously upheld laws across the country that remove or punish rogue Electoral College delegates who refuse to cast their votes for the presidential candidate they were pledged to support. The decision Monday was a loss for "{wi}faithless electors{/wi}," who argued that under the Constitution they have discretion to decide which candidate to support.

shortdef: an elector who votes in the electoral college for a candidate other than the one who won the popular vote in the elector's state
